sage.app

Class AbstractGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • sage.app.AbstractGame
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BaseGame, FixedFrameRateGame, VariableFrameRateGame

    public abstract class AbstractGame
extends java.lang.Object
    AbstractGame defines the methods which must be provided by every SAGE-based game. Game applications are created by extending AbstractGame and implementing each of the methods declared in AbstractGame. Subclasses may choose to implement only some of the AbstractGame methods, leaving the others abstract to be implemented by additional extending subclasses. (See BaseGame for an example of such a partial implementation.)
    Author:
    John Clevenger
    See Also:
    BaseGame, FixedFrameRateGame

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected abstract void exit()
      exit() is invoked to exit the game.
      protected java.lang.String getClassName()
      Returns the name of this class
      protected java.lang.String getMethodName()
      Returns the name of the method which was executing when a call to this method was made.
      protected abstract void handleInput(float time)
      handleInput() processes device input events, including invoking actions associated with those events.
      protected abstract void initGame()
      initGame() performs game-specific initialization, such as defining gameworld objects, setting up scoring rules, creating objects for HUD displays, etc.
      protected abstract void initSystem()
      initSystem() initializes the system platform for game operations, including such things as creating the display, rendering, and input manager subsystems.
      abstract boolean isGameOver()
      Returns true if the game has been terminated by a call to setGameOver(true).
      protected abstract void mainLoop()
      mainLoop() executes the "main loop" of a game, by repeatedly invoking handleInput(float), update(float), and render() until isGameOver() returns true.
      protected abstract void render()
      render() is invoked to cause the current game world to be rendered on the current display device.
      abstract void setGameOver(boolean isOver)
      setGameOver() is invoked to notify the rest of the application that the game is over and the application should shut down and exit.
      protected abstract void shutdown()
      shutdown() is invoked to notify the game application that the game is ending and that it should release all held resources.
      abstract void start()
      start() is the entry point for every game; it should be invoked from main() to begin the game.
      protected void throwUnimplementedOverridingMethodException() 
      protected abstract void update(float time)
      update() updates the game world state, including updating player and non-player characters, performing physics simulations, and all other functions required to advance the logic state of the game.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractGame

        public AbstractGame()

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public abstract void start()
        start() is the entry point for every game; it should be invoked from main() to begin the game. Every implementation of start() should invoke initSystem(), initGame(), and then mainLoop(), followed by invoking shutdown() and exit() after mainLoop() returns.

      • initSystem

        protected abstract void initSystem()
        initSystem() initializes the system platform for game operations, including such things as creating the display, rendering, and input manager subsystems.

      • initGame

        protected abstract void initGame()
        initGame() performs game-specific initialization, such as defining gameworld objects, setting up scoring rules, creating objects for HUD displays, etc.

      • mainLoop

        protected abstract void mainLoop()
        mainLoop() executes the "main loop" of a game, by repeatedly invoking handleInput(float), update(float), and render() until isGameOver() returns true.

      • handleInput

        protected abstract void handleInput(float time)
        handleInput() processes device input events, including invoking actions associated with those events.
        Parameters:
        time - -- The time since the last call to handleInput()
        See Also:
        IInputManager

      • update

        protected abstract void update(float time)
        update() updates the game world state, including updating player and non-player characters, performing physics simulations, and all other functions required to advance the logic state of the game. update() is responsible for invoking setGameOver(boolean) to indicate when the player has invoked a command to end the game.
        Parameters:
        time - The time since the last call to update()

      • render

        protected abstract void render()
        render() is invoked to cause the current game world to be rendered on the current display device.

      • setGameOver

        public abstract void setGameOver(boolean isOver)
        setGameOver() is invoked to notify the rest of the application that the game is over and the application should shut down and exit. setGameOver() is normally invoked from within mainLoop() when the player executes a command indicating the game is over.
        Parameters:
        isOver - - a boolean indicating that the game is over when true
        See Also:
        mainLoop()

      • isGameOver

        public abstract boolean isGameOver()
        Returns true if the game has been terminated by a call to setGameOver(true).
        Returns:
        - the current game-over flag state

      • shutdown

        protected abstract void shutdown()
        shutdown() is invoked to notify the game application that the game is ending and that it should release all held resources.

      • exit

        protected abstract void exit()
        exit() is invoked to exit the game.

      • getClassName

        protected java.lang.String getClassName()
        Returns the name of this class

      • getMethodName

        protected java.lang.String getMethodName()
        Returns the name of the method which was executing when a call to this method was made. This is useful for tracing programs.
        Returns:
        the name of the method which called getMethodName()

      • throwUnimplementedOverridingMethodException

        protected void throwUnimplementedOverridingMethodException()
